info.title: ClearBank Financial Institutions API
info.description:
The ClearBank® API is a REST based API that can be connected to in order to leverage ClearBank®’s products and banking services.

This ClearBank® Financial Institution API area in Swagger provides Financial Institutions with the required API endpoint information and message schema.

For the necessary information in order for Financial Institutions to successfully connect to ClearBank®’s API, refer to the Knowledge Centre.

All information is provided to you on a confidential basis and shall remain the property of ClearBank Ltd (including ownership rights in all intellectual property). All information is provided "as is" and without any implied warranty, representation, condition or otherwise, regarding its accuracy or completeness.

Copyright ClearBank Ltd. Authorised by the Prudential Regulation Authority and regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority and the Prudential Regulation Authority (Financial Services Register number: 754568). Registered Address: Level 29, 30 St. Mary Axe, London, England EC3A 8EP.

get.summary: Gets all accounts associated with your institution
get.description: All accounts are returned except those which have been disabled or where the account is a virtual account

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 50

parameters.description: Your API Token, retrieved from the web portal

post.summary: Creates an account with the specified name
post.description:
Currently, this endpoint only supports the creation of current accounts
            
AccountName must: not be null, only white space, only contain letters, numbers and the following special characters: - ,.

delete.summary: Requests cancellation for a Direct Debit mandate
delete.description:
Supported reason codes are:
0 - Institution cancelled - refer to payer. Paying bank has cancelled instruction.
1 - Instruction cancelled by payer. Payer has instructed the paying bank to cancel the DirectDebit Instruction.
2 - Payer deceased.
B - Account closed. Payer has closed their account for an unknown reason.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the account. This can be retrieved from GET /v1/Accounts

parameters.name: mandateId
parameters.description: The unique Direct Debit Instruction identifier

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Information required for cancelling the mandate

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API Token, retrieved from the web portal

parameters.name: DigitalSignature
parameters.description: Signed hash of the body of the request. The hash is signed by your private key

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the request

delete.description:
Supported reason codes are:
0 - Institution cancelled - refer to payer. Paying bank has cancelled instruction.
1 - Instruction cancelled by payer. Payer has instructed the paying bank to cancel the DirectDebit Instruction (Mandate).
2 - Payer deceased
B - Account closed. Payer has closed their account for an unknown reason.

parameters.description: The page size to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Controllers.BaseController.DefaultPageSize

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The start date time (when supplied) filters the result set to include transactions where the transaction time is either equal or greater than the value specified.

parameters.name: endDateTime

parameters.name: paymentMethodType
parameters.description: The payment method type filters the results to include that payment method type.

post.summary: Initiate a payment using the specified payment scheme
post.description:
This endpoint works on a partial acceptance basis - meaning that you can submit 10 payments and only 6 of them may be accepted for processing. Each payment instruction is validated against the scheme specific rules as well as the ISO20022 specification. Currently, only payments through GBP are supported. We have listed possible currencies for future proofing of the API. The remittance information must be scheme compatible. Values exceeding the length limits of the scheme will be truncated. Missing remittance information will be replaced by a blank string.
FPS
Account Holder Name - Required, alpha-numeric, space, comma, full-stop, hyphen (Max 18 characters) Sort code - 6 character length, must be numeric Account Number - required, 8 character length, must be numeric Amount - required, must be numeric and greater than 0 Payment Reference - required, alpha numeric, space, comma, full stop, hyphen, maximum length 18 characters (Description to be provided -if customer exceeds 18 characters this will be truncated)
CHAPS
Account Holder Name - Required, alpha-numeric, space, comma, full-stop, hyphen (Max 18 characters) Sort code - 6 character length, must be numeric Account Number - required, 8 character length, must be numeric Amount - required, must be numeric and greater than 0 Payment Reference - required, alpha numeric, space, comma, full stop, hyphen, maximum length 35 characters CHAPS availability - 8am - 5pm M-F (Business Days)

parameters.name: scheme
parameters.description: The name of the scheme through which monies should be transferred.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: The details of the payment instructions to be executed.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API Token, retrieved from the web portal

parameters.name: DigitalSignature
parameters.description: Signed hash of the body of the request. The hash is signed by your private key

parameters.name: X-Request-Id
parameters.description: A unique identifier for the request

get.summary: Gets a collection of transactions for account mandate
get.description: This is a paged endpoint, if no parameters are supplied the first page is returned, you can add date filter by supplying in the URL.

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the account. This can be retrieved from GET /v1/Accounts

parameters.name: mandateId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for Direct Debit Instruction.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Optional filter by start date. Date must be formatted as YYYY-mm-DD. For example ?startDate=1984-02-09

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: Optional filter by end date. Date must be formatted as YYYY-mm-DD. For example ?endDate=1990-10-04

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 50

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Your API Token, retrieved from the web portal

X-Correlation-Id.description: A unique identifier which should be referenced in any issue with any API call
A unique identifier which should be referenced in any issue with any API call
A unique identifier which should be referenced in any issue with any API call

get.summary: Gets a summary of all of the transactions from the specified account

parameters.name: accountId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the account. This can be retrieved from GET /v1/Accounts

parameters.name: virtualAccountId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the virtual account.

parameters.name: pageNumber
parameters.description: The page number to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 1

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The page size to control returned results into manageable sets. Default if not supplied: 50

parameters.name: startDateTime
parameters.description: The start date time (when supplied) filters the result set to include transactions where the transaction time is either equal or greater than the value specified.

parameters.name: endDateTime
parameters.description: The end date time (when supplied) filters the result set to include transactions where the transaction time is either equal or less than the value specified.

parameters.name: paymentMethodType
parameters.description: The payment method type filters the results to include that payment method type.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Represents one or more accounts and associated hypermedia links

accounts.description: A collection of all accounts belonging to the institution associated with the API token.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Represents a summary of a given account

id.description: The unique identifier for the account

name.description: The friendly name of the account

type.description: Specifies the type of the account

balances.description: Balances associated with the account in the given currencies

iban.description: The IBAN identifier associated with the account

bban.description: The BBAN identifier associated with the account

upic.description: The Universal Payment Identification Code (UPIC) associated with the account

cuid.description: The CHIPS Universal Identifier associated with the account

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: A single hypermedia link

templated.description: Specifies "true" if href is a URI template, i.e. with parameters. Otherwise, this property is absent or set to false

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: A summary of the balance of an account, in a specific currency

amount.description: The amount of monies, relative to the specified currency, in the account

currency.description: The ISO 4217 currency code of the account

status.description: The type of balance that is being reported

lastCommittedTransaction.description: The reference of the last committed transaction against the account

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Information that is used to create a Current Account

accountName.description: The friendly name that should be associated with the account

owner.description: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation

sortCode.description: The sort code these accounts should be created under

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Set of elements used to identify a person or an organisation

name.description: Name by which a party is known and which is usually used to identify that party

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Represents a single account and associated hypermedia links
A ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Response.ProblemDetails for validation errors.

errors.description: Gets or sets the validation errors associated with this instance of ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Response.ValidationProblemDetails.

type.description:
A URI reference [RFC3986] that identifies the problem type. This specification encourages that, when
dereferenced, it provides human-readable documentation for the problem type
(e.g., using HTML [W3C.REC-html5-20141028]).  When this member is not present, its value is assumed to be
"about:blank".

status.description: The HTTP status code([RFC7231], Section 6) generated by the origin server for this occurrence of the problem.

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem.

instance.description: A URI reference that identifies the specific occurrence of the problem. It may or may not yield further information if dereferenced.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Information required for a current account amendment

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Returns list of all unapplied direct credit transactions for the specified criteria/request

pendingTransactionId.description: The internal identifier of the pending transaction.

processingDate.description: The date that transaction is processed.

settlementDate.description: The date that we settle transactions internally.

transferredDate.description: The date that funds are transferred.

serviceUserNumber.description: The service user number for the debtor.

isReturn.description: Indicates the pending transaction is the result of an existing cash transaction.

hasReturn.description: Indicates the pending transaction has a return transaction.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Coun.description: Information about the counterpart in a given transaction
The identifible information of an account

iban.description: The IBAN number of the account

other.description: Unique identification of an account, as assigned by the account service, using an identification scheme

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Coun.description: Unique identification of an account, as assigned by the account servicer, using an identification scheme

issuer.description: The name of the entity that assigns the identification

code.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a coded form as published in an external list

proprietary.description: Name of the identification scheme, in a free text form

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Returns list of all unpaid direct debit transactions for the specified criteria/request
DirectDebitMandates by Account Response
Direct Debit Mandate

serviceUserNumber.description: Holds the service user number, in case the service user associated with the mandate is not one of our internal service users

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description:
Request to create a DDM
IBAN and BBAN account identifiers are supported

mandateType.description:
The specified Instruction type for the request. 
(You will only use “Origination” and “Migrated” if you are transferring a sort code from another Direct Participant to the ClearBank® domain. “Migrated” indicates that the DDI was initially received as a paper item but later re-lodged in AUDDIS format by the Service User)

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: An API response which contains no additional properties

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Request to cancel a Mandate
Request to cancel a Mandate

reasonCode.description: Reason code for requesting the amendment

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Direct Debit Mandate Reject Request

rejectionReason.description: The reason why the DDI is being returned

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Represents one or more transactions against the specified institution and associated hypermedia links

transactions.description: A collection of the transactions against the specified account

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Represents information regarding a transaction

amount.description: The instructed amount and applied currency for the instructed amount

counterpartAccount.description: Information about the counterpart in a given transaction

endToEndIdentifier.description: The scheme specific end to end transactional identifier

transactionId.description: The unique identifier for this transaction

transactionReference.description: The user supplied reference for the transaction

transactionTime.description: The date/time the transaction occurred relative to UTC

status.description: The current status of the transaction

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Amou.description: Indicates the amount and the currency used in a given transaction or account balance

instructedAmount.description: Amount of money to be moved between the debtor and creditor, before deduction of charges, expressed in the currency as ordered by the initiating party

currency.description: The currency code must be a valid active currency code, not yet withdrawn on the day the message containing the currency is exchanged. Valid active currency codes are registered with the ISO 4217 Maintenance Agency, consist of three (3) contiguous letters, and are not yet withdrawn on the day the message containing the Currency is exchanged

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Information that should be used to create a credit transfer

paymentInstructions.description: Details of the payments to be made

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: A payment from a single account to multiple creditors

paymentInstructionIdentification.description: The unique identifier for the payment instruction

requestedExecutionDate.description: Optional: The ISO 8601 date/time that the instruction should be executed at. Deprecated: Any value specified here will be ignored

creditTransfers.description: A series of payments that should be made from the debtor account

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: The name and, optionally, the legal entity identifier of the account

name.description: The name of the account holder

legalEntityIndentifier.description: The legal entity identifier of the account holder (eg: charity number). This should be supplied if known

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Represents a creditor in a payment instruction

paymentIdentification.description: Identifying information for the credit transfer

amount.description: The instructed amount and applied currency for the instructed amount

creditorAccount.description: Information about the counterpart in a given transaction

remittanceInformation.description: Information regarding the payment, eg: payment reference

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Identification of the payment instruction

instructionIdentification.description: Unique identification, as assigned by an instructing party for an instructed party, to unambiguously identify the instruction

endToEndIdentification.description: Unique identification, as assigned by the initiating party, to unambiguously identify the transaction. This identification is passed on, unchanged, throughout the entire end-to-end chain

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system

structured.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Information supplied to enable the matching/reconciliation of an entry with the items that the payment is intended to settle, such as commercial invoices in an accounts' receivable system, in a structured form.

creditorReferenceInformation.description: Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Reference information provided by the creditor to allow the identification of the underlying documents.

reference.description: A reference, as assigned by the creditor, to unambiguously refer to the payment transaction.

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: The result of each payment instruction and applicable links

transactions.description: The acceptance or rejection status of each individual payment instruction

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: An individual response for a debtor/creditor pairing

endToEndIdentification.description: The unique identifier for the payment instruction

response.description: The result of how we are going to process the individual payment instruction

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: List of transactions

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Transaction associated with mandate

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Resp.description: Returns list of all unpaid transactions for the specified criteria/request

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Request to make a return of transaction

returns.description: Array of transactions to be returned

ClearBank.FI.API.Versions.V1.Models.Bind.description: Direct Debit Transaction to be returned

reasonCode.description:
Reason for return, single character only,
Allowed ReasonCode for Bacs Direct Credit:
    0 - Invalid details,
    2 - Beneficiary deceased,
    3 - Account transferred,
    5 - No account,
    B - Account closed,
    C - Requested by Remitter.
Allowed ReasonCode for Direct Debit:
    0 - Refer to payer, 
    1 - Instruction canceled, 
    2 - Payer deceased, 
    3 - Account transferred, 
    4 - Advance notice disputed,
    5 - No account(OR wrong account type),
    6 - No Instruction, 
    7 - Amount differs, 
    8 - Amount not yet due, 
    9 - Presentation overdue,
    A - Service user differs,
    B - Account closed.
